record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="Menu add" and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"

brief.brief: To set up a new menu, open Service Manager Administrator Menu. On that menu, select Menu Setup & Maintenance. Alternatively, type the command "menu" in the Command line and press Enter.

detail.detail: Specify the name of the new menu at the menu name prompt. To find out if the menu name is in use, press Enter at the blank screen. Alternatively, type a name at the menu name prompt. If it already exists, Service Manager displays the menu record.

Fill in the following fields as appropriate for the options that you want to define on your new menu. Once you have defined all items on the new menu (including access to other menus, if necessary,) press F1 (Add) to save the record and display a confirmation of the addition function.
Note: Each menu name must be unique. If you choose a menu name that already exists in the menu table, Service Manager displays the message: "Invalid duplicate key."
You must connect a new menu to an existing menu to ensure its access. Do this by modifying the existing menu record.
